intro: Gagea exilis, commonly known as the slender gagea, is a small bulbous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Its bulbs are small and underground, serving as storage organs for nutrients. Gagea exilis is often found in association with other spring-flowering plants in its native range.
